title: Supervisor Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview was performed via a Zoom meeting with two people. Easy going. Questions regarding working with others, best working environment, professional future goals, and aspirations. Interviewers were professional and direct.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. I recommend this job if you are young and looking for experience or looking to get in the health care field. It would get you the experience you need
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: General Dentist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GPHA
Interview Descriptions:
Great. It was laid back and they give  a lot of information about their benefit packages. . Did not ask a lot of questions. 
However, the interview process seems long
Interview Questions: What do you know about GPHA

title: Health Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GPHA
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good.  Not sure what will transpire after the interview.  Still waiting.  I would love to work for this company.  I think that company would be a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: Asking about your future goals or aspirations

title: MA/RA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GPHA in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: they will want you to triage and they rate you on how well you preform. blood pressure, height and weight, for adults and children, and there is a paper test that ask whats a normal BP and what the refrigerator temperature should be.
Interview Questions: tell me about you self and that was it

title: Medical Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at GPHA (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply on monster.com, got phone call in a month or less, had an 15 minutes in-person interview and was offered the job the same day, but had to wait for background check results to come back to start working. Total process took less than 3 months.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at GPHA (Phila, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: First had to do an skills assessment at the corporate office then after waiting for two months finally had an interview with the office manager. After getting a job offer had to submit a new hire packet and waited weeks for the FBI fingerprint check.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict on the workplace?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GPHA (Phila, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Confusing and long, several different people before you get the actual interview. HR first then the hiring manager, your offer the job then they do your background checks. You then go back to HR for paperwork signing. The you wait like almost a month to start training

title: Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at GPHA (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief, to the point. The interviewers started very late in both occasions and did not have any experience working with interpreters. The outcome was good, since I got the job.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe the way I did my work previously

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at GPHA (Phila, PA) in Dec 2010
